did.unittitle: Elizabeth Danto Collection: Sarah Lawrence College Strike and Teach-In re: United States' Invasion of Cambodia

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 1970 Elizabeth Danto was a student at Sarah Lawrence college. She participated in the Sarah Lawrence College strike and teach-in, one of thousands of such events at colleges and universities, occasioned by the U.S. invasion of Cambodia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains (non-official) student newsletters, principally Emanon, which provide a near-daily account of the events, a detailed list of teach-in programs and other student-created documents, and research materials on the invasion of Cambodia and the Vietnam war, principally Agency French Press dispatches. The four folders that comprise this collection are arranged alphabetically. The folder titles are:
